title: Trimming, early 19th century
medium: White, black, and colored silks in voided velvet weave.
creditline: Gift of Mrs. Robert Woods Bliss, Dumbarton Oaks Collection
description: Two shields, each under a crown, one displaying arms with motto, "Vis mea est lex et rex." (Trans. "My strength is law and king.")  The other, a spread eagle, in black, yellow, and tan on a white ground.

tombstone.epitaph:
Trimming, early 19th century.
early 19th century. White, black, and colored silks in voided velvet weave.. Gift of Mrs. Robert Woods Bliss, Dumbarton Oaks Collection. 1943-46-57.
